trans-unit.source: Secure a database in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Secure a database in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Tips for securing a database in Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.
trans-unit.target: Tips for securing a database in Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.

trans-unit.source: This article walks through the basics of securing your Azure SQL Data Warehouse database.
trans-unit.target: This article walks through the basics of securing your Azure SQL Data Warehouse database.

trans-unit.source: In particular, this articles will get you started with resources for limiting access, protecting data, and monitoring activities on a database.
trans-unit.target: In particular, this articles will get you started with resources for limiting access, protecting data, and monitoring activities on a database.

trans-unit.source: Connection Security refers to how you restrict and secure connections to your database using firewall rules and connection encryption.
trans-unit.target: Connection Security refers to how you restrict and secure connections to your database using firewall rules and connection encryption.

trans-unit.source: Firewall rules are used by both the server and the database to reject connection attempts from IP addresses that have not been explicitly whitelisted.
trans-unit.target: Firewall rules are used by both the server and the database to reject connection attempts from IP addresses that have not been explicitly whitelisted.

trans-unit.source: To allow your application or client machine's public IP address to attempt connecting to a new database, you must first create a server-level firewall rule using the Azure Management Portal, REST API, or PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: To allow your application or client machine's public IP address to attempt connecting to a new database, you must first create a server-level firewall rule using the Azure Management Portal, REST API, or PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: As a best practice, you should restrict the IP address ranges allowed through your server firewall as much as possible.
trans-unit.target: As a best practice, you should restrict the IP address ranges allowed through your server firewall as much as possible.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Azure SQL Database firewall</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Azure SQL Database firewall</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Authentication refers to how you prove your identity when connecting to the database.
trans-unit.target: Authentication refers to how you prove your identity when connecting to the database.

trans-unit.source: SQL Data Warehouse currently supports SQL Authentication with a username and password.
trans-unit.target: SQL Data Warehouse currently supports SQL Authentication with a username and password.

trans-unit.source: When you created the logical server for your database, you specified a "server admin" login with a username and password.
trans-unit.target: When you created the logical server for your database, you specified a "server admin" login with a username and password.

trans-unit.source: Using these credentials, you can authenticate to any database on that server as the database owner, or "dbo."
trans-unit.target: Using these credentials, you can authenticate to any database on that server as the database owner, or "dbo."

trans-unit.source: However, as a best practice your organization’s users should use a different account to authenticate -- this way you can limit the permissions granted to the application and reduce the risks of malicious activity in case your application code is vulnerable to a SQL injection attack.
trans-unit.target: However, as a best practice your organization’s users should use a different account to authenticate -- this way you can limit the permissions granted to the application and reduce the risks of malicious activity in case your application code is vulnerable to a SQL injection attack.

trans-unit.source: The recommended approach is to create a contained database user, which allows your app to authenticate directly to a single database with a username and password.
trans-unit.target: The recommended approach is to create a contained database user, which allows your app to authenticate directly to a single database with a username and password.

trans-unit.source: You can create a contained database user by executing the following T-SQL while connected to your user database with your server admin login:
trans-unit.target: You can create a contained database user by executing the following T-SQL while connected to your user database with your server admin login:

trans-unit.source: For more information on authenticating to a SQL Database, see <linkText>Managing databases and logins in Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on authenticating to a SQL Database, see <linkText>Managing databases and logins in Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Authorization refers to what you can do within an Azure SQL Data Warehouse database, and this is controlled by your user account's role memberships and permissions.
trans-unit.target: Authorization refers to what you can do within an Azure SQL Data Warehouse database, and this is controlled by your user account's role memberships and permissions.

trans-unit.source: As a best practice, you should grant users the least privileges necessary.
trans-unit.target: As a best practice, you should grant users the least privileges necessary.

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Data Warehouse makes this easy to manage with roles in T-SQL:
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Data Warehouse makes this easy to manage with roles in T-SQL:

trans-unit.source: The server admin account you are connecting with is a member of db_owner, which has authority to do anything within the database.
trans-unit.target: The server admin account you are connecting with is a member of db_owner, which has authority to do anything within the database.

trans-unit.source: Save this account for deploying schema upgrades and other management operations.
trans-unit.target: Save this account for deploying schema upgrades and other management operations.

trans-unit.source: Use the "ApplicationUser" account with more limited permissions to connect from your application to the database with the least privileges needed by your application.
trans-unit.target: Use the "ApplicationUser" account with more limited permissions to connect from your application to the database with the least privileges needed by your application.

trans-unit.source: There are ways to further limit what a user can do with Azure SQL Database:
trans-unit.target: There are ways to further limit what a user can do with Azure SQL Database:

trans-unit.source: Database roles other than dbdatareader and dbdatawriter can be used to create more powerful application user accounts or less powerful management accounts.
trans-unit.target: Database roles other than dbdatareader and dbdatawriter can be used to create more powerful application user accounts or less powerful management accounts.

trans-unit.source: Granular <linkText>Permissions</linkText><title></title> let you control which operations you can do on individual columns, tables, views, procedures, and other objects in the database.
trans-unit.target: Granular <linkText>Permissions</linkText><title></title> let you control which operations you can do on individual columns, tables, views, procedures, and other objects in the database.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Stored procedures</linkText><title></title> can be used to limit the actions that can be taken on the database.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Stored procedures</linkText><title></title> can be used to limit the actions that can be taken on the database.

trans-unit.source: Managing databases and logical servers from the Azure Management Portal or using the Azure Resource Manager API is controlled by your portal user account's role assignments.
trans-unit.target: Managing databases and logical servers from the Azure Management Portal or using the Azure Resource Manager API is controlled by your portal user account's role assignments.

trans-unit.source: For more information on this topic, see <linkText>Role-based access control in Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on this topic, see <linkText>Role-based access control in Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Data Warehouse can help protect your data by encrypting your data when it is "at rest," or stored in database files and backups, using <linkText>Transparent Data Encryption</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Data Warehouse can help protect your data by encrypting your data when it is "at rest," or stored in database files and backups, using <linkText>Transparent Data Encryption</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To encrypt your database, connect as a database owner and execute:
trans-unit.target: To encrypt your database, connect as a database owner and execute:

trans-unit.source: You can also enable Transparent Data Encryption from database settings in the <linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can also enable Transparent Data Encryption from database settings in the <linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Auditing and tracking database events can help you maintain regulatory compliance and identify suspicious activity.
trans-unit.target: Auditing and tracking database events can help you maintain regulatory compliance and identify suspicious activity.

trans-unit.source: SQL Data Warehouse Auditing allows you to record events in your database to an audit log in your Azure Storage account.
trans-unit.target: SQL Data Warehouse Auditing allows you to record events in your database to an audit log in your Azure Storage account.

trans-unit.source: SQL Data Warehouse Auditing also integrates with Microsoft Power BI to facilitate drill-down reports and analyses.
trans-unit.target: SQL Data Warehouse Auditing also integrates with Microsoft Power BI to facilitate drill-down reports and analyses.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Get started with SQL Database Auditing</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Get started with SQL Database Auditing</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For more development tips, see <linkText>development overview</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more development tips, see <linkText>development overview</linkText><title></title>.
